intro: Ceropegia johnstonii, commonly known as the Johnston's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Ceropegia johnstonii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
